book_name: CAE Oxford Human Performance and Limitations

questions.question: If a runway slopes downwards, how does this affect the pilots' approach?
options: a. It is likely to be too high
b. It is likely to be too low
c. It is likely to be too fast
d. It is likely to be too slow

questions.question: If a runway slopes upwards, how does this affect the pilots' approach?
options: a. It is likely to be too high
b. It is likely to be too low
c. It is likely to be too fast
d. It is likely to be too slow

questions.question: What is the likely effect of a runway which is wider than expected?
options: a. Flaring too late and damaging the aircraft
b. Flaring too soon and causing a heavy landing
c. Approach speed much too high
d. Approach speed higher than usual

questions.question: What approach conditions cause the "black hole effect"?
options: a. Landing at night in sleet or heavy rain
b. Landing at night with a partially lit runway
c. Landing at night with the cockpit instruments turned up too high
d. Landing at night when there are no lights between the aircraft and the runway

questions.question: How does the "black hole effect" alter the pilots' judgement of the approach?
options: a. Overestimation of height
b. Underestimation of height
c. Tends to make the approach much too fast
d. Tends to make the approach faster than normal

questions.question: What are the main visual cues for rounding out?
options: a. Round out height and speed
b. Confirmation of decision height and closing speed
c. Closing speed and height check
d. Apparent speed of ground objects increases and texture of ground changes.

questions.question: How do misty/foggy conditions affect the pilots judgement on the approach?
options: a. Underestimating range due to illusionary effect through cockpit glass
b. Underestimating range due to the lights appearing dim
c. Underestimating range due to illusionary effect through cockpit glass
d. Overestimating range due to the lights appearing dim

questions.question: If two aircraft are on a line of constant bearing, what is the likely outcome?
options: a. Depends whether by day or by night
b. They will collide
c. There will be a near miss
d. It is quite safe and they will pass well clear of each other

questions.question: How will an oncoming aircraft on a line of constant bearing appear visually?
options: a. There will be no relative movement and it will appear to be very small until seconds before the collision
b. There will be no relative movement and it will appear to be very small until seconds before the aircraft passes close by
c. There will be no relative movement and it will appear to be very small until seconds before the aircraft passes above
d. There will be no relative movement and it will appear to be very small until seconds before the aircraft passes well clear

questions.question: What is the duration of a saccade and rest period?
options: a. 0.3 seconds
b. 0.5 seconds
c. 0.013 seconds
d. 1 second

questions.question: What visual technique should be used when searching for an aircraft?
options: a. Sweep from side to side with the eyes covering the whole field of vision
b. Search the sky portion by portion starting on the left
c. Pinpoint 10° segments of the sky and confirm before passing onto another
d. Use a succession of small and rapid eye movements

questions.question: Refraction, due to rain on the windscreen, makes the approach:
options: a. steeper
b. shallower
c. faster
d. slower

questions.question: Expectation can affect perception.
options: a. True
b. False

questions.question: The blooming effect of rain makes:
options: a. the runway appear closer
b. the runway appear further away
c. does not effect runway perception
d. the instruments difficult to read

questions.question: What are the laws that the Gestalt Theory propose?
options: a. The laws of Perception
b. The laws of Perceptual Illusions
c. The laws of Perceptual Reception
d. The laws of Perceptual Organization

questions.question: A visual scan should cover the sky in overlapping sections of:
The scanning technique should differ by day and night.
options: a. True
b. False

questions.question: A distant aircraft is identified and remains on a constant relative bearing. You should:
options: a. wait until the aircraft appears to grow larger before taking avoiding action
b. take avoiding action if you do not have right of way
c. take immediate avoiding action
d. wait two seconds to reidentify and then take avoiding action

questions.question: Another name for the illusion associated with acceleration is:
options: a. the somatogyral illusion
b. the somatogravic illusion
c. motion sickness
d. air sickness

questions.question: If an illusion is known to be possible at a particular aerodrome, as Captain of the aircraft, you should:
options: a. ensure you brief the crew
b. say nothing as it might frighten the crew
c. report the fact to operations so that other crews are aware of the danger
d. report the fact to your operator so that other crews are aware of the danger
